Issues.Title: Fix 'align' attribute in td/th being ignored- Fixes #2414
Issues.Body:
This is a **bugfix**.

Fixes issue #2414:
There are multiple `<td>` and `<th>` selectors which set `text-align:left` taking precedence over the elements' attribute `align` (from HTML versions lower than HTML5)

### Proposed solution
From  `<th>` and `<td>` selectors which set `text-align` deselect elements with attribute `align`.

### Tradeoffs
None detected

### Testing Done
Tested in Firefox 66.0 and Chrome 73.0.3683.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix 'align' attribute in td/th being ignored- Fixes #2414" (#2420)

Issues.Title: Make site-level overflow properties variables
Issues.Body: The defaults for the site-level `overflow-x` and `overflow-y` properties are reasonable in most cases, but not always. I recently got burned in a project where a phantom extra scrollbar was appearing on Chrome on Linux and I couldn't figure out why. I addressed the issue by applying `html { overflow-y: auto !important }` but it'd be great if I could apply that via variable instead.

Issues.Title: Link Visited Variable Not Used
Issues.Body: This is about **Bulma**. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.7.4] _Via NPM_ My **browser** is: All I am sure this issue **was previously reported approximately 1yr ago** in #1888 ### Description It appears that `$link-visited` is [defined](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/50fb74d6c8e74772a5a31e94457bbf35462a092f/sass/utilities/derived-variables.sass#L56) but never [used](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/sass/base/generic.sass#L62) unlike `$link-hover`, which is both [defined](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/50fb74d6c8e74772a5a31e94457bbf35462a092f/sass/utilities/derived-variables.sass#L58) & [used](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/sass/base/generic.sass#L69). I found [no other reference](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/search?q=%24link-visited&unscoped_q=%24link-visited) to the `$link-visited` variable throughout the SASS files. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Install Bulma v0.7.2 2. Add HTML markup with a link ```HTML ... Visit Me ... ``` 3. Customize the link variables ```SCSS $link-visited: #CCCCCC; $link-hover: #EFEFEF; ``` 4. See only hover state change on link ### Expected behavior Link `:visited` color to change. ### Actual behavior No change in `:visited` color of link.

Issues.Title: content CSS class causes align attibute on td/th to be ignored
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. This is a bug in the CSS ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate** ### Description When including pre-formatted content in a container with the `content` CSS class applied, the tables in the pre-formatted content ignore the `align="right"` or `align="center"` attributes when applied to `td/th` tags. All table cells are *left* aligned. In my case, this was encountered while using the `marked` markdown library to render pre-formatted HTML. ### Steps to Reproduce ```HTML
RightCenterLeft
RightCenterLeft
``` ### Expected behavior Table cells inside a `content` block should respect the `align` attribute for cells. ### Actual behavior All table cells inside a `content` block are left aligned regardless of the `align` attribute applied. ### Workaround Adding the following CSS allows the `align` attribute to be respected. ```CSS .content td[align="right"], .content th[align="right"]{ text-align: right; } .content td[align="center"], .content th[align="center"] { text-align: center; } ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "content CSS class causes align attibute on td/th to be ignored" (#2414)

Issues.Title: Partials naming convention - SASS Partial's name should start with an underscore "_"

Issues.Body:

Add a suggestion in the docs readme to include the `--open-url` or `--o` option in the `jekyll serve` command to automatically open the server URL after it has finished building. At least I find the command `jekyll serve --open-url --incremental --config _config.local.yml` very handy for a launcher batch script so I thought I'd share.
